item.name: Silicon
item.description: A hard, brittle crystalline solid with a blue-grey metallic lustre. A tetravalent metalloid and semiconductor.

item.name: Graphite
item.description: A crystalline form of the element carbon with its atoms arranged in a hexagonal structure.

item.name: Copper
item.description: A soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

item.name: Aluminium
item.description: A silvery-white, soft, non-magnetic and ductile metal in the boron group.

item.name: Titanium
item.description: A lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density, and high strength.

item.name: Polystyrene
item.description: A synthetic aromatic hydrocarbon polymer, one of the most widely used plastics.

item.name: Rubber
item.description: A compound of isoprene polymers, with minor impurities of other organic compounds and water.

item.name: Glass
item.description: A non-crystalline, often transparent amorphous solid, usually formed by rapid cooling of the molten form.
